verses.roman:
dhanuṣo bhajyamānasya
śabdaḥ khaṁ rodasī diśaḥ
pūrayām āsa yaṁ śrutvā
kaṁsas trāsam upāgamat

synonyms: dhanuṣaḥ—of the bow; bhajyamānasya—which was breaking; śabdaḥ—the sound; kham—the earth; rodasī—the sky; diśaḥ—and all the directions; pūrayām āsa—filled; yam—which; śrutvā—hearing; kaṁsaḥ—King Kaṁsa; trāsam—fear; upāgamat—experienced.
translation: The sound of the bow's breaking filled the earth and sky in all directions. Upon hearing it, Kaṁsa was struck with terror.
